meanings.definition: A collection of related data or information stored in a structured format.
meanings.sent1: My brother keeps all his music records neatly organized on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The company's financial records are kept in a secure database.
meanings.sent3: I found it amusing that my cat's grooming records were more detailed than my own.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a well-organized library, each event neatly stored in its own record.
meanings.sent5: The records of ancient civilizations provide valuable insights into their way of life.

meanings.definition: The act of keeping track of something by writing it down.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to keep daily records of their reading habits.
meanings.sent2: She diligently kept records of her expenses in a small notebook.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see my dog trying to keep records of the squirrels in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a record book, jotting down every detail with precision.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous records of the weather patterns helped predict the upcoming storm.

meanings.definition: The best performance or achievement in a particular sport or activity.
meanings.sent1: The athlete broke the long-standing high jump record at the competition.
meanings.sent2: Her record in swimming remains unbeaten for five years now.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the squirrel trying to break the acorn-gathering record.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to practice made his performance soar like a new record.
meanings.sent5: The record-breaking speed of the cheetah left everyone in awe.
